title: Recycling Depot Collection and Delivery Route Planning
desc_split: A recycling company operates from a central depot (<loc_depot>) and needs to collect recyclables from <num_customer> commercial businesses while also delivering empty recycling containers to new clients. Businesses either require a delivery of containers (linehaul) or a pickup of filled containers (backhaul), and routes can mix these tasks in any order. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring no truck exceeds its weight limit and all routes stay within the distance cap.

Deliveries (linehaul) and pickups (backhaul) can be sequenced flexibly, but the total weight of produce plus returned goods must never exceed the van’s capacity. The challenge is to balance efficient route planning with the dual task of fulfilling orders and managing returns.
